title: What's News: Business & Finance
text:
Policy makers at the Jackson Hole, Wyo., symposium signaled growing unease with the trade-offs they could soon confront amid the fight against inflation.

Retailers have a glut of inventory and are discounting items to clear space for holiday goods, with many having already lowered profit expectations for the year.

Airlines and airports worldwide are extending passenger caps and cuts to flight schedules through the fall and winter as they try to steady operations.

NASA's scheduled test launch on Monday of a new mega-rocket will give Boeing another chance to prove it can pull off big national projects following past missteps.

Facebook parent Meta agreed to settle a suit that accused the social-media platform of allowing third parties, including Cambridge Analytica, to access private user data.

China's industrial profit dropped in the first seven months of the year, reversing a year-on-year increase in the first half.

What's News: Business & Finance
